Headline: Hamas issues terror threat to Israel: 'We will return to the Intifada'
Date and Time: 2023-09-16 23:36:26
Link: https://www.jpost.com/middle-east/article-759405
Summary: Saleh al-Arouri, Deputy Head of Hamas, and a delegation from the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) met in Beirut to discuss their opposition against Israel. They called on the Palestinian Authority to return to the intifada for national unity and the settlement of the Palestinian home. The leaders reviewed their goals and discussed recent clashes in the Ain al-Hilweh refugee camp, expressing support for stabilizing the ceasefire. They emphasized the need to prohibit internal fighting and the non-use of weapons to resolve conflicts in Palestinian camps. They also expressed a desire for peace between Lebanese citizens and authorities. Arouri previously threatened regional warfare against Israel, to which Prime Minister Netanyahu responded by stating that Hamas and Iran would face consequences for terrorist attacks.

They clashed at border points and within Israeli territory, with most of the clashes occurring in southern Israel. The Al Qassem Brigade, along with the Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ), carried out rocket attacks and fought against Israeli security forces in various towns. Additionally, Lebanese Hezbollah and Palestinian militias in the West Bank also conducted attacks on Israeli positions, potentially expanding the conflict to a second front. The incident has sparked a blame game between Israel and Palestinians, with Hamas authorities in Gaza claiming it was caused by Israeli airstrikes and the Israeli Defense Forces pointing fingers at a misfired Islamic Jihad rocket. Islamic Jihad is a Palestinian Islamist militant group formed in 1981 that opposes peace with Israel and aims to establish an Islamic state in Palestine. It has links with Hamas and receives support from Iran and Syria. The group is more radical than Hamas and has clashed with the Palestinian Authority over security cooperation with Israel. Islamic Jihad is active in the Gaza Strip, carrying out attacks against Israeli targets. The conflict between Israel and Hamas, a Palestinian Islamist militant group, escalated significantly in late 2023. The Deputy Head of Hamas, Saleh al-Arouri, issued a terror threat to Israel on September 16, 2023, calling for a return to the intifada, a term referring to Palestinian uprisings against Israel [source](https://www.jpost.com/middle-east/article-759405). 

The situation escalated further on October 7, 2023, when Hamas launched a surprise attack on Israel, marking the most significant breach of Israel's borders since the 1973 Yom Kippur War. The attack resulted in the death of over 1,400 Israelis and the capture of over 200 hostages [source](https://www.dw.com/en/israel-updates-netanyahu-says-war-will-take-time/live-67030177?maca=en-rss-en-all-1573-rdf). This attack was reportedly planned with the help of Iranian security officials and marked a significant escalation in the conflict [source](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/iran-helped-hamas-plot-devastating-attack-on-israel/articleshow/104271764.cms).

In the aftermath of the attack, Israel vowed to eliminate Hamas and began preparing for a military operation against the group in the Gaza Strip [source](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiTmh0dHBzOi8vd3d3Lndhc2hpbmd0b25wb3N0LmNvbS93b3JsZC9pbnRlcmFjdGl2ZS8yMDIzL3Bob3Rvcy1pc3JhZWwtaGFtYXMtd2FyL9IBTmh0dHBzOi8vd3d3Lndhc2hpbmd0b25wb3N0LmNvbS93b3JsZC9pbnRlcmFjdGl2ZS8yMDIzL3Bob3Rvcy1pc3JhZWwtaGFtYXMtd2FyLw?oc=5). 

The conflict has also seen the involvement of other Palestinian militias and groups such as the Al Qassem Brigade and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ), which have carried out attacks against Israeli security forces [source](https://www.understandingwar.org/backgrounder/iran-update-october-8-2023). 

The conflict has resulted in significant civilian casualties, with an explosion at Gaza's Ahli Arab Hospital killing at least 500 individuals [source](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/what-is-islamic-jihad-the-group-being-blamed-by-israel-for-bombing-at-gaza-hospital/articleshow/104513381.cms).

Summary: Iran has launched a spy satellite, Khayyam, on a Russian Soyuz rocket from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan. The country is in talks with Russia to receive assistance in building a new Khayyam satellite, as well as plans for a small geostationary satellite and a telecommunications satellite. The Russian space industry has suffered financially due to a loss of business and economic sanctions, leading to the search for new partnerships such as Iran. Iran also has plans to develop and launch additional satellites, including a constellation of 10 small satellites known as the General Soleimani Satellite System. Although Iran has expressed interest in sending humans to space, they are currently limited to launching small satellites to low orbit.

The relationship between Israel and Iran has been marked by significant tension and conflict, particularly in 2023. Iran has been involved in activities that threaten regional stability, including supporting Palestinian militias in their attacks on southern Israel. The Iranian Foreign Affairs Minister, Abdollahian, has met with Hamas and Qatari officials, suggesting that the conflict between Hamas and Israel could escalate into a multi-front conflict [source](https://www.understandingwar.org/backgrounder/iran-update-october-15-2023).

Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi has criticized a proposed Israeli-Saudi normalization deal, calling on Islamic countries to unite against the perceived crimes committed by the United States and Israel [source](https://www.jpost.com/middle-east/iran-news/article-761240). This comes at a time when the US and Saudi Arabia are moving towards a security pact that would require the US to defend Saudi Arabia against an attack, potentially from Iran.

Iran's activities have also been a source of concern for Israel due to Iran's nuclear program. Israel's Atomic Energy Commission Director-General, Moshe Edri, has called for global discussions on nuclear safety and security, particularly in light of the risks posed by Iran's nuclear program [source](https://www.jpost.com/international/article-760560).

In addition to its nuclear activities, Iran has also been seeking Russian assistance for a new spy satellite, which could potentially be used for military purposes [source](https://www.space.com/iran-russia-help-khayyam-spy-satellite). This move could further escalate tensions between Iran and Israel, as it could potentially provide Iran with enhanced capabilities to monitor Israeli activities.

Overall, the relationship between Israel and Iran in 2023 has been marked by significant tension and conflict, with Iran's support for Palestinian militias and its nuclear activities being major sources of concern for Israel.

The relationship between Israel and Hezbollah, a Lebanese militant group, has been marked by significant tension and conflict in 2023. On November 2, 2023, Hezbollah attacked 19 Israeli positions along the Lebanon-Israel border, which led to a retaliatory assault from Israel. This escalation in tensions occurred in the context of the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas, another militant group [source](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/11/2/lebanon-israel-border-fighting-picks-up-ahead-of-hezbollah-leaders-speech?traffic_source=rss).

Hezbollah's activities have not been confined to the Middle East. On November 9, 2023, two men suspected of being connected to Hezbollah were arrested in São Paulo, Brazil, for allegedly plotting to attack Jews. The Israeli intelligence agency, Mossad, assisted in thwarting the purported attack, attributing the plan to Hezbollah, which is believed to be funded and directed by the Iranian regime [source](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-67367483?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=KARANGA).

Hezbollah has also been implicated in a significant attack on Israel carried out by Hamas. This attack resulted in a death toll exceeding 1,000 [source](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/iran-helped-hamas-plot-devastating-attack-on-israel/articleshow/104271764.cms).

Overall, the relationship between Israel and Hezbollah in 2023 has been marked by significant tension and conflict, with Hezbollah's attacks on Israeli positions and its alleged involvement in plots against Jews in Brazil and a significant attack on Israel carried out by Hamas.

In the context of the conflict between Israel and Hamas in 2023, the issue of a ceasefire has been a contentious one. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu rejected calls for a ceasefire in the Gaza conflict, stating that it "will not happen" as it would be "to surrender to Hamas." His statement came during a press conference on October 30, 2023. Netanyahu also appealed for more international help in rescuing the over 230 hostages seized by Hamas. Despite these calls, the UNWRA Commissioner-General Philippe Lazzarini criticized Israel's actions in Gaza as "collective punishment" and called for a "humanitarian cease-fire" to facilitate aid delivery [source](https://www.dw.com/en/israel-hamas-war-netanyahu-rejects-calls-for-cease-fire/live-67251983?maca=en-rss-en-all-1573-rdf).

Earlier in the month, on October 7, 2023, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) reportedly regained control over the majority of settlements in Israel's south, which had been infiltrated by Hamas and Islamic Jihad militants. This included settlements such as Sderot, Sofa, Kerem-Shalom, Nirim, and others. Despite this, the attacks by Hamas militants resulted in a large number of missiles being launched into Israel, causing fires in Israeli cities and resulting in a death toll of over 200, with more than 1,100 people injured [source](https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2023/10/7/7423111/).
Please provide a holistic and thorough analysis on the Israel Hamas conflict consider all the articles, in addition build a timeline of events

The conflict between Israel and Hamas, a Palestinian Islamist militant group, escalated significantly in late 2023. Here is a timeline of the key events:

1. **September 16, 2023**: The Deputy Head of Hamas, Saleh al-Arouri, issued a terror threat to Israel, calling for a return to the intifada, a term referring to Palestinian uprisings against Israel [source](https://www.jpost.com/middle-east/article-759405).

2. **October 7, 2023**: Hamas launched a surprise attack on Israel, marking the most significant breach of Israel's borders since the 1973 Yom Kippur War. The attack resulted in the death of over 1,400 Israelis and the capture of over 200 hostages. This attack was reportedly planned with the help of Iranian security officials and marked a significant escalation in the conflict [source](https://www.dw.com/en/israel-updates-netanyahu-says-war-will-take-time/live-67030177?maca=en-rss-en-all-1573-rdf).

3. **October 8, 2023**: Palestinian militias, including Hamas and the Al Qassem Brigade, continued to fight against Israeli security forces. They clashed at border points and within Israeli territory, with most of the clashes occurring in southern Israel [source](https://www.understandingwar.org/backgrounder/iran-update-october-8-2023).

4. **October 9, 2023**: Iran's alleged involvement in the planning and execution of the Hamas attack on Israel was reported. If proven, this could further escalate tensions in the region [source](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/iran-helped-hamas-plot-devastating-attack-on-israel/articleshow/104271764.cms).

5. **October 18, 2023**: An explosion at Gaza's Ahli Arab Hospital resulted in the deaths of at least 500 individuals, leading to global condemnation and protests in Muslim nations [source](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/what-is-islamic-jihad-the-group-being-blamed-by-israel-for-bombing-at-gaza-hospital/articleshow/104513381.cms).

6. **October 26, 2023**: Iran's Foreign Minister, Hossein Amirabdollahian, warned at the United Nations that if Israel's retaliation against Hamas in Gaza continues, the United States will not be spared from the consequences [source](https://news.yahoo.com/un-iran-warns-us-not-163248877.html).

7. **October 30, 2023**: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated that his country will not accept a cease-fire in its conflict with Hamas [source](https://www.allsides.com/news/2023-10-30-1512/middle-east-netanyahu-ce

The conflict between Israel and Hamas in 2023 was marked by significant escalations and a high number of casualties. The conflict was triggered by a terror threat issued by the Deputy Head of Hamas, Saleh al-Arouri, on September 16, 2023, calling for a return to the intifada, a term referring to Palestinian uprisings against Israel. This set the stage for a series of violent confrontations between the two sides.

The situation escalated dramatically on October 7, 2023, when Hamas launched a surprise attack on Israel. This marked the most significant breach of Israel's borders since the 1973 Yom Kippur War and resulted in the death of over 1,400 Israelis and the capture of over 200 hostages. This attack was reportedly planned with the help of Iranian security officials, indicating the involvement of external actors in the conflict.

In the aftermath of the attack, Palestinian militias, including Hamas and the Al Qassem Brigade, continued to fight against Israeli security forces. They clashed at border points and within Israeli territory, with most of the clashes occurring in southern Israel. This sustained aggression further exacerbated the conflict.

The conflict also saw significant civilian casualties. An explosion at Gaza's Ahli Arab Hospital on October 18, 2023, resulted in the deaths of at least 500 individuals, leading to global condemnation and protests in Muslim nations.

As the conflict continued, Iran's Foreign Minister, Hossein Amirabdollahian, warned at the United Nations on October 26, 2023, that if Israel's retaliation against Hamas in Gaza continues, the United States will not be spared from the consequences. This statement highlighted the potential for the conflict to have broader geopolitical implications.

Despite calls for a ceasefire, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated on October 30, 2023, that his country will not accept a ceasefire in its conflict with Hamas. This indicated a determination to continue the conflict until certain objectives, such as the defeat of Hamas, were achieved.

Overall, the conflict between Israel and Hamas in 2023 was characterized by significant escalations, high casualties, and the involvement of external actors. The refusal of both sides to agree to a ceasefire suggests that the conflict is likely to continue, with potentially serious implications for regional stability.
